sep.gaia.resources

Class Loader<Q extends Query,R extends DataResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • sep.gaia.resources.Loader<Q,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    Q - The type of the query-objects used.
    R - The type of the resources to be generated.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class Loader<Q extends Query,R extends DataResource>
extends java.lang.Thread
    An abstract class for accepting queries for resources, asynchronously loading and returning them. Queries can be added to a prioritized queue and generated resources fetched from a second queue. The processing cycle can be stopped by calling interrupt(). May delay until the currently processed query is done.
    Author:
    Matthias Fisch

    • Constructor Detail

      • Loader

        public Loader(Cache<R> cache,
      WorkerFactory<Q,R> workerFactory,
      QuerySplitter<Q> splitter)
        Initializes the loader with a cache preferably used to obtain resources.
        Parameters:
        cache - The cache to be checked before loading data or null if no cache should be used.
        workerFactory - Object for generating new workers in order to process specific queries.
        splitter - An object for splitting queries into smaller parts for asynchronous processing. If no splitting is required this member must be null.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates the workers, starts all of them and waits for them to finish. Once a worker has finished all listeners must be notified about the presence of new data. If the interrupt-flag is set by calling interrupt() all workers will be interrupted too.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • request

        public void request(Q query)
        Adds query to the queue of queries to be processed. The object will be inserted with default priority.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to be added to the queue.

      • request

        public void request(Q query,
           int priority)
        Adds query to the queue of queries to be processed.
        Parameters:
        query - The query to be added to the queue.
        priority - The priority of the query.

      • clearQueryQueue

        public void clearQueryQueue()
        Removes all entries from the query-queue and stops all workers processing a query.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(LoaderEventListener<R> listener)
        Adds an listener to be notified about newly loaded data.
        Parameters:
        The - listener to add.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(LoaderEventListener<R> listener)
        Removes an listener to be notified about newly loaded data.
        Parameters:
        The - listener to remove.

      • requestWorkersStop

        public void requestWorkersStop()
        Requests all active workers to stop. The actual stopping of each worker may be delayed. Note that this method will block until asynchronous operations of the loader are finished.

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Requests the loader-thread and all its active workers to stop. The actual stopping of both the loader and its workers may be delayed.
        Overrides:
        interrupt in class java.lang.Thread

      • getCache

        public Cache<R> getCache()
